content: अमर {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [मृ-पचाद्यच् न. त.] Undying, immortal, imperishable; अजरामरवत् प्राज्ञो विद्यामर्थं च साधयेत् <ls>H. Pr. 3</ls>, <ls>Ms. 2. 148.</ls> --रः {@--1@} A god, deity. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of a Marut. {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of a plant (स्नुहीवृक्ष). {@--4@} Quicksilver. {@--5@} Gold. {@--6@} A species of pine. {@--7@} The number 33 (that being the number of Gods). {@--8@} <ab>N.</ab> of Amarasiṃha, see below; of of a mountain. {@--9@} Mystical signification of the syllable उ. {@--10@} A heap of bones. --रा {@--1@} The residence of Indra (<ab>cf.</ab> अमरावती). {@--2@} The naval string; umbilical cord. {@--3@} The womb. {@--4@} A house-post (स्थूणा). {@--5@} <ab>N.</ab> of several plants; इंद्रवारुणी, वटी, महानीली, घृतकुमारी, स्नुही, गुडूची, दूर्वा. --री The same as अमरा.
